titleInfo.title: Governor's School of Tennessee: arts, summer 1986

originInfo.publisher: Center for Popular Music, Middle Tennessee State University

location.physicalLocation: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.abstract: A program guide for the Tennessee Governor's School for the Arts, which is a four-week summer program for rising eleventh and twelfth grade students in Tennessee. "The 1986 program at MTSU focused on music, visual arts, and theatre."

titleInfo.title: University Collections, MTSU Miscellaneous, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.accessCondition: Copyright protected. Reproduced with permission of the University Reproduction is permitted for non-profit educational and research purposes only

relatedItem.abstract: Created to commemorate the University's centennial in 2011, this digital collection contains photographs, memorabilia and other materials that document the critical role played by MTSU within the broader community during its first century. Please note that two separate collections also document MTSU History: The Midlanders collection contains complete digital copies of the Midlander yearbook from 1926 to 2004. The Sidelines collection contains digital copies of a nearly-complete run of Sidelines, the student newspaper of the university, from 1938 to 2011. MTSU Memory is a collaborative project of the Albert Gore Research Center and the James E. Walker Library.

mods.note: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Center for Popular Music, Middle Tennessee State University
